statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Bakari Copeland scored 23 points and Maryland-Eastern Shore beat Morgan State 80-71 in the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference regular-season finale for both teams.
article.headline: Maryland-Eastern Shore beats Morgan State 80-71
article.story: BALTIMORE -- Bakari Copeland scored 23 points and Maryland-Eastern Shore beat Morgan State 80-71 in the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference regular-season finale for both teams. Copeland made 13 of 15 from the line and grabbed six rebounds for UMES (10-21, 7-9). Dominique Elliott had 14 points on 7-of-10 shooting with nine boards, Ryan Andino had 11 points and Isaac Taylor added 10. The Hawks shot over 59 percent overall, outscored the Bears 40-20 in the paint and won the rebound battle 38-26. Morgan State (8-21, 6-10) was led by Phillip Carr with 17 points and seven rebounds. Rasean Simpson scored 16 points and Cedric Blossom added 15. UMES led 41-33 at intermission, and after the half quickly ran the score up to 55-37 following a dunk by Derrico Peck. Morgan State chipped away, though, and got the deficit back to four with 4:11 left on a layup by Blossom. The Hawks responded with a seven-point spurt to push it back to double digits.
